greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} (-1)^k*P(n,k)*k!, where P(n,k) is the number of partitions of n into k parts.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..449
mathematica: CoefficientList[ Series[ Sum[ n!(-x)^n / Product[1 - x^k, {k, n}], {n, 0, 22}], {x, 0, 22}], x]
program: [sum([(-1)^k*number_of_partitions_length(n,k)*factorial(k) for k in (0..n)]) for n in (0..22)]
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Aug 01 2015
